text: so percussion and matmos treasure state
okay
hello my needle drops anthony fantano
here internet's busiest music nerd it's
time for an album review
treasure state this lp is a new
collaboration from a duo who i hold in
very high regard matmos matt moses music
usually is heavily based on electronics
and samples i haven't reviewed this lp
but have some praises of it 2008 supreme
balloon that thing is just amazingly
colorful and kaleidoscopic that lp was
entirely based on synthesized sound but
if you go into matmos earlier stuff you
hear everything sampled from semen to
water to surgery and though 2008 supreme
balloon was amazing to me
i kind of just awaited these guys to
come back into the fold with sampling
live acoustic stuff again but actually
going out and recording ice thawing or
something like that seems hardly
necessary on this new lp because of who
they're collaborating with so percussion
which is a new york percussion
ensemble because of them i'm sure if
there's anything on this planet that
makes a noise when you hit it it is on
this album bells chimes pipes wood oddly
shaped pieces of metal on the second
track what sounds like water being rung
out of a towel into a bucket you could
literally spend hours trying to make out
the sounds on this thing sometimes i
think i hear shells or pickup sticks but
now i'm just getting really into it the
results of this racket though are pretty
musical most of the time just like the
opening track treasure which is a
minimalist dream just lots of layers and
little instruments just little
instrumental sounds all doing their own
tiny repetitive part to make something
much bigger which is pretty much the
story with most of these tracks just
starting out with something little and
building it up into something a lot less
little because let's face it the songs
here
even at their most lush and busy are not
really that loud or overbearing
everything's pretty easy going and soft
and quaint and though i keep talking
about these stranger sounds on this lp
there is normal instrumentation on here
too of course you're going to pick up
drums you're going to pick up acoustic
guitars there are horns on here quite a
bit of horns
sound wise pretty much all the bases are
covered there's really too much stuff
here to process in even three sittings
what really does end up bugging me about
this lp though is that it is really
really lacking in variety when it comes
to structure and style seriously i'm no
expert on so percussion i mean i know
some of the people they've collaborated
with but this collaboration in
particular really doesn't sound like
matmos or
so are going too far outside of their
comfort zones instead kind of just
indulging further into what they do best
because each group is kind of working
with someone who is on the same
wavelength as them hey you're really
into sound we're really into sound let's
just make some wacky
sounds it's really difficult to ignore
that almost every track here builds into
just a quirky wall of noises but don't
get me wrong there are some interesting
melodies here and they do change it up
every once in a while like on the track
needles which stands out just because it
really goes overboard with the
overboard in a good way and the track
cross which is almost unintentionally a
hip-hop instrumental here and there i'm
just catching some deja vu some points
are a little too reserved for me and it
just comes down to liking some tracks
and not liking others before i end this
review i want to tell you guys that
there is a link in the d box to where
you can hear a new track from the new
blonde redhead lp on the needledrop.com
and thank you guys a lot for many of the
nice nice nice comments i got on
yesterday's video where my girlfriend
and i reviewed the new animal collective
movie you guys are so nice but all that
aside i'm feeling a decent maybe a
strong six on this thing there are some
standout moments some tracks that i
would definitely take away from it and
just be like oh i like these these are
my pretty little favorite tricks but
this album in no way is another supreme
balloon for me which is just
mind-blowing
all right guys if you've heard it what
do you think of this lp do you love it
do you hate it and why and also i hope
everyone's having a good day
yeah
anthony fantano matmos so percussion
treasure state
forever
you
